patterns.name: service-class
patterns.description: Service class pattern for business logic
patterns.example: export class UserService { constructor(private db: Database) {} }
antiPatterns: Direct database access without service layer

patterns.name: repository-pattern
patterns.description: Repository pattern for data access abstraction
patterns.example: export interface UserRepository { findById(id: string): Promise<User | null>; }
antiPatterns: Mixing data access with business logic

patterns.name: custom-hooks
patterns.example: export function useAuth() { const [user, setUser] = useState(null); return { user }; }
